section.title: Integrals, Integral Representations, and Integral Equations

para.sentence: Let w=\cosh z\cos t\cos\alpha+\sinh z\sin t\sin\alpha.

Then \dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}e^{2\mathrm{i}hw}\mathrm{ce}_{n}\left(t,h^{2} \right)\mathrm{d}t={\mathrm{i}^{n}}\mathrm{ce}_{n}\left(\alpha,h^{2}\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(1)}_{n}}\left(z,h\right), \dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}e^{2\mathrm{i}hw}\mathrm{se}_{n}\left(t,h^{2} \right)\mathrm{d}t={\mathrm{i}^{n}}\mathrm{se}_{n}\left(\alpha,h^{2}\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(1)}_{n}}\left(z,h\right), \dfrac{\mathrm{i}h}{\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\frac{\partial w}{\partial\alpha}e^{2 \mathrm{i}hw}\mathrm{ce}_{n}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t={\mathrm{i}^{n}} \mathrm{ce}_{n}'\left(\alpha,h^{2}\right){\mathrm{Mc}^{(1)}_{n}}\left(z,h \right), \dfrac{\mathrm{i}h}{\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\frac{\partial w}{\partial\alpha}e^{2 \mathrm{i}hw}\mathrm{se}_{n}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t={\mathrm{i}^{n}} \mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(\alpha,h^{2}\right){\mathrm{Ms}^{(1)}_{n}}\left(z,h \right).

In (28.28.7)–(28.28.9) the paths of integration \mathcal{L}_{j} are given by \mathcal{L}_{1}\mbox{ : from }-\eta_{1}+\mathrm{i}\infty\mbox{ to }2\pi-\eta_{ 1}+\mathrm{i}\infty,\mathcal{L}_{3}\mbox{ : from }-\eta_{1}+\mathrm{i}\infty\mbox{ to }\eta_{2}- \mathrm{i}\infty,\mathcal{L}_{4}\mbox{ : from }\eta_{2}-\mathrm{i}\infty\mbox{ to }2\pi-\eta_{1 }+\mathrm{i}\infty, where \eta_{1} and \eta_{2} are real constants.
0<\operatorname{ph}\left(h(\cosh z\pm 1)\right)<\pi.
In particular, when h>0 the integrals (28.28.11),(28.28.14) converge absolutely and uniformly in the half strip \Re z\geq 0 , 0\leq\Im z\leq\pi.
where the upper or lower sign is taken according as 0\leq y\leq\pi or \pi\leq y\leq 2\pi.
For details and further equations see Meixner et al. (1980, §2.1.1)andSips (1970).

subsection.title: Integrals of Products with Bessel Functions

para.sentence: In particular, for integer \nu and \ell=0,1,2,\dots , \dfrac{2}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}\mathcal{C}^{(j)}_{2\ell}(2hR)\cos\left(2\ell\phi \right)\mathrm{ce}_{2m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=\varepsilon_{\ell}(-1)^ {\ell+m}A^{2m}_{2\ell}(h^{2}){\mathrm{Mc}^{(j)}_{2m}}\left(z,h\right), where again \varepsilon_{0}=2 and \varepsilon_{\ell}=1 , \ell=1,2,3,\ldots.

\dfrac{2}{\pi}\int_{0}^{\pi}\mathcal{C}^{(j)}_{2\ell+2}(2hR)\sin\left((2\ell+2 )\phi\right)\mathrm{se}_{2m+2}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{\ell+m}B^{ 2m+2}_{2\ell+2}(h^{2}){\mathrm{Ms}^{(j)}_{2m+2}}\left(z,h\right).

subsection.title: Integrals of Products of Mathieu Functions of Noninteger Order
Integrals of Products of Mathieu Functions of Integer Order

para.sentence: Again with the parameter h suppressed, let \mathrm{Ds}_{0}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Ds}_{1}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Ds}_{2}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{m}}'\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{m}}'\left(z\right).

Then \dfrac{\sinh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\cos t\mathrm{se}_{n}\left(t,h^{ 2}\right)\mathrm{se}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t}\mathrm {d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(s)}\mathrm{Ds}_{0}\left(n,m ,z\right), \dfrac{\cosh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\sin t\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(t,h^ {2}\right)\mathrm{se}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t} \mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(s)}\mathrm{Ds}_{1} \left(n,m,z\right), where m-n=2p+1 , p\in\mathbb{Z} ; m,n=1,2,3,\dots.

Also, \widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(s)}=\dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\cos t\mathrm{se}_{ n}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{se}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p} \dfrac{2}{\mathrm{i}\pi}\dfrac{\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(0,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{se} _{m}'\left(0,h^{2}\right)}{h\mathrm{Ds}_{2}\left(n,m,0\right)}.

Let \mathrm{Dc}_{0}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Dc}_{1}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right), \mathrm{Dsc}_{0}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{n}}\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right),\mathrm{Dsc}_{1}\left(n,m,z\right)={\mathrm{Ms}^{(3)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(4)}_{m}}\left(z\right)-{\mathrm{Ms}^{(4)}_{n}}'\left(z\right){ \mathrm{Mc}^{(3)}_{m}}\left(z\right).

Then \dfrac{\cosh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\sin t\mathrm{se}_{n}\left(t,h^{ 2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t}\mathrm {d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\beta}_{n,m}\mathrm{Dsc}_{0}\left(n,m,z \right), \dfrac{\sinh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\cos t\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(t,h^ {2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t} \mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\beta}_{n,m}\mathrm{Dsc}_{1}\left(n,m, z\right), where m-n=2p+1 , p\in\mathbb{Z} ; m=0,1,2,\dots , n=1,2,3,\dots.

Also, \widehat{\beta}_{n,m}=\dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\sin t\mathrm{se}_{n}\left (t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p}\dfrac{2 }{\mathrm{i}\pi}\dfrac{\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(0,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m} \left(0,h^{2}\right)}{h\mathrm{Dsc}_{1}\left(n,m,0\right)}.

Next, \dfrac{1}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\sin\left(2t\right)\mathrm{se}_{n} \left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2 }}t}\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p}\mathrm{i}\widehat{\gamma}_{n,m}\mathrm{Dsc}_{0}\left( n,m,z\right), \dfrac{\sinh\left(2z\right)}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\mathrm{se}_{n}' \left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2 }}t}\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}\widehat{\gamma}_{n,m}\mathrm{Dsc}_{1} \left(n,m,z\right), where n-m=2p , p\in\mathbb{Z} ; m=0,1,2,\dots , n=1,2,3,\dots.

Also, \widehat{\gamma}_{n,m}=\dfrac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(t,h ^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\dfrac{4}{ \mathrm{i}\pi}\dfrac{\mathrm{se}_{n}'\left(0,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left( 0,h^{2}\right)}{\mathrm{Dsc}_{1}\left(n,m,0\right)}.

Lastly, \dfrac{\sinh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\cos t\mathrm{ce}_{n}\left(t,h^{ 2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t}\mathrm {d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(c)}\mathrm{Dc}_{0}\left(n,m ,z\right), \dfrac{\cosh z}{\pi^{2}}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\dfrac{\sin t\mathrm{ce}_{n}'\left(t,h^ {2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)}{{\sinh^{2}}z+{\sin^{2}}t} \mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p+1}\mathrm{i}h\widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(c)}\mathrm{Dc}_{1} \left(n,m,z\right), where m-n=2p+1 , p\in\mathbb{Z} ; m,n=0,1,2,\dots.

Also, \widehat{\alpha}_{n,m}^{(c)}=\frac{1}{2\pi}\int_{0}^{2\pi}\cos t\mathrm{ce}_{n }\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_{m}\left(t,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{d}t=(-1)^{p+1} \dfrac{2}{\mathrm{i}\pi}\dfrac{\mathrm{ce}_{n}\left(0,h^{2}\right)\mathrm{ce}_ {m}\left(0,h^{2}\right)}{h\mathrm{Dc}_{0}\left(n,m,0\right)}.
See Prudnikov et al. (1990, pp. 359–368),Gradshteyn and Ryzhik (2000, pp. 755–759), Sips (1970), andMeixner et al. (1980, §2.1.1).
